title: FPS Drop and CPU Usage Patterns
body:
Hello League community. I am hoping you guys can help me. 

I recently installed league on my computer after doing a Windows 10 reinstall which wiped the previous system clean. After updating all my drivers and doing everything on the FPS guide I figured I'd open a ticket and come to you guys. Many people seem to be experiencing FPS drops right now without a means of fixing it. I previously was playing on maxed settings with 100+ FPS no problems. Now I install and I'm under 15 at same settings. The strange thing is this: when I track the CPU usage of league it decreases as the settings increase. Yeah, weird. I gradually increase the settings and resolution to see what the CPU does, when it is absolute lower settings it uses 20 - 30% of CPU. But, when I increase to max it eventually reaches under 10%. Very confusing...

Please help me guys.

Cheers

replies.body:
I have gone through all of the FPS guide to no avail. V-sync is off. I've tried the audio no luck. 

Spec are as such
8GB RAM
GTX 560 2GB
Intel i5-3570K CPU @ 3.40GHZ

Been running over 100fps on max for years. All of a sudden can't get above 20.

This might be a case where your pc is starting off using the integrated graphics at first and then switches over once the settings hit a certain point. I'd recommend turning off v-sync as well as running through the rest of the steps in the [**FPS guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) too.
Out of curiosity, have you tried disabling In-Game Audio? (Not muting with Windows or tuning the Volume to 0, actually disabling the Audio)
System specs please. Make, model, graphics card, RAM bus speed and quantity, etc.
